description: From hexagons in a circle problem.
comments: Numbers n such that (n^2 + n + 1)/3 is a square. [Arkadiusz Wesolowski, Feb 10 2012]
references: Kevin A. Broughan, An explicit bound for aliquot cycles of repdigits, #A15 INTEGERS  Vol 12  (2012) p. 4.
J. D. E. Konhauser et al., Which Way Did the Bicycle Go?, MAA 1996, p. 104.
T. Nagell, Des équations indéterminées  x^2 + x + 1 = y^n   et  x^2 + x + 1 = 3*y^n, Norsk Mat. Forenings Skrifter, Ser. I, (1921).
links: Michel Marcus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: a(n) = sqrt(3)*((2+sqrt(3))^(2*n+1) - (2-sqrt(3))^(2*n+1))/4 - 1/2 (see Kevin A. Broughan paper) [_Michel Marcus_, Jul 28 2012]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
